availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Adair County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Dorothy Miller. Father of John S. Miller, Jeremiah O. Miller, Juliett T. Miller, Otho James Miller, Joseph J. Miller, Samuel W. Miller, Thomas B. Miller, Anne Miller, Timolion Miller, Dicey Miller, and Gaither Miller, Jr. Constable in Adair County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Adair County in 1850. Farmer in Adair County in 1860. Farmer in Adair County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 2, p. 59A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 2, p. 32.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, County, City/District, p. X
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, Second District, p. 24.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Adair County, KY, September 1863, p. 118 (Accessed via ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "Gaither Miller (1819-1873)," Memorial #93249685, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/93249685 (accessed June 1, 2020).
